Description: Bronze mirror-disc; slightly elliptical disc with a pierced rectangular tang for attachment to handle (missing); rim incomplete; surface heavily corroded.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: M.-J. Chavane, La nécropole d’Amathonte Tombs 110-385. IV. Les petits objets (Nicosia 1990) for examples of simple mirror types from Amathus, pp. 13-14. The type has a long life, but this example is probably Roman along with the rest of the tomb assemblage.
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 82, Tomb 72 no. 2)
